definitions.definition: To engage the attention of; to awaken interest in; to excite emotion or passion in, in behalf of a person or thing.
examples: It might interest you to learn that others have already tried that approach.
Action films don't really interest me.

definitions.definition: To be concerned with or engaged in; to affect; to concern; to excite.
To cause or permit to share.

main_definition: To engage the attention of; to awaken interest in; to excite emotion or passion in, in behalf of a person or thing.
secondary_definitions: ( obsolete , often impersonal ) To be concerned with or engaged in; to affect; to concern; to excite.
( obsolete ) To cause or permit to share.
